Sass Conf

October 2-4, 2014

domReady

It's easy. Works like this:

js domready(function () { // dom is loaded! })

## Deprecation Notice

Compatibility with IE6, IE7, and IE8 has been fully dropped. If your application requires this level of support, please use the 0.3.0 release.

Browser support

  • IE9+
  • Firefox 4+
  • Safari 3+
  • Chrome *
  • Opera *

Building

sh npm install make open tests/test.html

Including with Ender

Don't already have Ender? Install it like this:

sh npm install ender -g

Include domready in your package:

sh ender add domready

Then use it like this

``` js require('domready')(function () { $('body').html('<p>boosh</p>') })

// or

$(document).ready(function () { $('body').html('<p>boosh</p>') }) ```
